definition: not to mind/unconcerned
(negative prefix)/not/no
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: And most of their parents don't care; but some of the kids do.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的家长不以为意，但有些学生心存感激。

sentences.english: Mr. Lewis takes an insufferably glib attitude toward it all.
sentences.chinese: 刘易斯先生对这一切不以为意，令人厌恶。

sentences.english: Mostly, however, the reaction has been a shrug of the shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 然而，大多数人的反应都是不以为意。

sentences.english: In other words, maybe we’ll all just get over it.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，或许我们都只是不以为意了。

definition: not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
to pay no attention to/not to mind
decline to comment/not express an opinion/be noncommittal/hedge
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
(literary) to sneer/to laugh at
grinning/smiling
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to contempt/to disdain/pejorative
smiling/with a smile
displeased/annoyed
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
careless/heedless/absent-minded/indifferent
each minding his own business
